alert.note: Alert for Marathon; Menominee; Portage; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Waupaca; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 30 at 3:59AM CDT until March 30 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FREEZING RAIN WILL PRODUCE HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS THIS MORNING... .Freezing rain will gradually change to rain from south to north during the mid to late morning as temperatures slowly rise. Much of the advisory area will see ice accumulations of one-tenth to one-quarter inch, with the highest amounts over north central Wisconsin. Untreated roads, bridges and overpasses will be ice covered and hazardous for the morning commute, so motorists should use extreme caution. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Freezing rain, with total ice accumulations around a tenth of an inch. Locally higher amounts possible across northern Marathon, northwest Shawano and western Menominee counties. * WHERE...Portions of central and northeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The precipitation will change to rain by mid-morning today. It will transition back to snow this evening, probably continuing into Thursday morning. Several inches of snow accumulation can be expected.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Marathon; Menominee; Portage; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Waupaca; Wood
